properties.areaDesc: West Slopes North Cascades and Passes
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 5 at 4:08AM PST until January 6 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 4000 feet, heavy snow
expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches. For the
Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 4 to 12 inches.

* WHERE...Cascade mountains and valleys of Whatcom and Skagit
Counties, the Mount Baker Ski Area.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST
Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this
morning to 4 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Slow down and use caution while traveling.

For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET
